title: People complain that Darius is too oppresive vs melees at top
body:
Why the fuck do these same people not give a shit about Karma, Nidalee, Quinn, and many more ranged top laners being WAY more oppressive to these same melee champions?

You have no fucking chance vs these ranged top lane as if you get in range they will just smack you away or have escapes out the ass.

Saw the thread name, completely agreed that Darius was an oppressive top. You point out other champs that you considered to be just as oppressive, but the key difference between them and Darius is that Darius has much more late-game/utility and zoning potential than any of the ones you listed (Yes this is a very unsupported claim because you could argue for days that Quinn has more late game because she does more damage late-game or that some other champ is better late game. However the main point I mean by late-game is that if you go any top that you listed, your team usually won't be a very good comp). What I mean by zoning potential, is that early game Darius Q does significantly more poke than any of the champs you listed. Since Darius is melee, and after 6 he can insta kill you with pull, he can completely zone you during lane where the champs you listed really can't. Darius has the typical bruiser issue, his scaling is too high in comparison to other champs and it just leads to him having a brutal laning phase.

He has poor scaling unless he builds full AD, he can't insta kill ANYBODY when he pulls them unless they were already below 40% health, he can't completely zone as he is a very easy to bait champion with or without jungler help. 

Darius does not have more zoning than a Quinn, Nidalee, Lissandra, etc, they can poke you down for days before getting bored and all inning you as they get it easy in lane vs melees.

There's a reason these ranged champs are played top, it's because they got nerfed out or were never viable in their actual places and Top lane is easy for them to abuse.

>You have no fucking chance vs these ranged top lane as if you get in range they will just smack you away or have escapes out the ass.

{{champion:127}} I don't know what you're talking about.
Look at that ranged champ

Every time I play Nasus (no h8 pls) against Darius, I just farm and not die until I can 1v1 him, which happens at around 10 or 15 minutes in.

With someone like Quinn, I just get blinded (which negates my Q entirely), and then kited, and eventually shredded (because BoTrK).

When you're playing a melee champion top lane and you're against a ranged you generally have 2 options. Depending on the actual champion you are playing and facing, if you have some form of dash/jump or mobility in general that is better then the ranged champions...you could just jump/dash to them and start fighting back early. Since you are melee, you generally have better early game stats then most ranged champions, and if you have more mobility or some form of CC, you can actually fight them. However, if you do not have any form of CC or mobility over the ranged top, you could always just play safe under tower and let them push to your tower. Just farm under tower until they either get greedy and turret dive you or your jungler comes around. Once Mid/Late game hits, you will generally out scale them and be a bigger threat then them.

However, if you're a melee champion and you are facing Darius that's completely different. Darius is designed to easily win trades against other melees early game, and can go tank and still easily out damage you. Sure you can still let him push to your tower and farm under it but he could easily get to the point that he will dive you and still walk away alive. Most melee champions will easily get destroyed against Darius, and there's only a few that probably can go even with him early.

Also you can't just build full tank and expect to win against him once he hits level 6. However, you could always go full tank against a ranged damage and still do decent against them (well...most ranged champs anyways)

I feel it is more because it is a melee vs. melee match up.  When it is ranged vs. melee, they accept that they should be able to be poked down by the ranged, but in most cases if you catch that ranged champion, you can win later, even if you fall behind early.  Against Darius he can just dunk you and snowball super hard off of that, while still also going tanky, which is why I think a lot of people complain about him more.
